executive_summary: Through the current period, shifts in demographics and advances in medical technology have boosted demand for healthcare services and, consequently, for nurses. The aging of the baby boomer generation, as well as medical professionals' improved ability to treat ailments, have increased the number of patients in medical facilities. This, combined with the essential role of the healthcare sector amid the COVID-19 pandemic, has created a solid job market for those pursuing nursing careers. Despite growing demand, severe challenges to affordability in recent years have offset the early period's gains, and industry revenue has declined at a CAGR of 1.2% to an estimated $8.5 billion over the five years through 2024, when revenue is expected to climb 1.1%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Strong demand for nurses has buoyed revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As the baby boomer population continues to reach the later stages of life, the average age of the US population continues to climb. As more and more adults reach the later stages of life and encounter more health complications, the healthcare sector has experienced growing demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Dropping disposable income has made consumers hesitant
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As inflation ramped up in 2022 and 2023, essential purchases and utility bills became more expensive for consumers, dragging down per capita disposable income.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Stagnating government funding contributed to drop
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While federal funding for universities rose through the early period, the expiration and suspension of pandemic-related aid exposed nursing schools to a stagnation in revenue as government support slumped.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Potential students will be better able to afford
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Federal funding for universities is anticipated to grow through the next period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Nurses will continue to be in high demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Declining birth rates will continue pushing the average age upwards.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry provide medical instruction and issue nursing certifications.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level high - steady

key_trends: Demand is localized, so concentration is low.
Other higher education institutions pose a substitute.
Nursing schools are under pressure to remain affordable.
Nursing schools have struggled to be affordable.
The AACN helps support the industry.
Wages are the industry's top cost.
Profit has climbed even amid revenue declines.
Young adults make up the largest market.
Baccalaureate programs are the most popular service.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Individuals under 25 make up nearly half of all students.
As students complete undergraduate degrees, they become more likely to be admitted into advanced graduate programs.
Students in their 30s have gained sufficient experience and have become interested enough in continuing a career in nursing.
Students in their 40s also make up a significant portion of those pursuing Master's or doctorates in nursing.
As consumers reach their later years, there is little reason for them to pursue continuing education.

products_and_services.product_description: Bachelor's degrees make up the bulk of industry revenue.
Responsibilities include administrative or educational roles.

tier_1_suppliers: Medical Device Manufacturing in the US
Medical Supplies Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Funding for universities measures federal, state and local grants that affect nursing program affordability.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Changes in Government Funding Can Impact Nursing Schools
regulations_points.regulation_description: As universities, nursing schools are highly dependent on federal and state funding that supports their operations.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Expensive to acquire staff and medical equipment
barriers_points.barrier_description: It's extremely expensive to acquire the staff and medical equipment required to begin instructing the next generation of nurses.
Demand is localized, so concentration is low.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages are the Industry's Top Expense
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Teaching salaries are significant because teaching is performed face-to-face.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Nursing instructors often hold advanced degrees
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Instructors could command higher salaries working in hospitals.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Nurse practices need to stay up-to-date with best practices
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Nursing schools have to keep their content filled with recent advancements.

FAQs.question: What are some key points about changes in government funding impacting nursing schools?
FAQs.answer: As universities, nursing schools are highly dependent on federal and state funding that supports their operations.
